description: I started the full stack web development course by Code Institute on the 14th of June 2018, and submitted all projects finishing the course on 11th December 2018. I finally received my diploma on the 8th February 2019.

company: Ace Panel Systems- Adelaide, South Australia
description: Ace Panel Systems build industrial and commercial coolrooms, freezers and ice rooms, using foam insulated panels with a thin steel outer layer.
The main tasks involved assisting the leading hand to mark out, cut, erect and secure foam panels.
other_tasks: Securing of base channel to concrete foundation;
The 2nd fix of quarter round angle, and
Sealing joins with cool room tape and creating an air tight seal with a sealant (mastic).

description: SA Construct is a commercial and residential cladding and roofing company.
In my short time there before taking another job offer, I worked on Adelaide's St Andrews Hospital, securing lengths of aluminium battens and 600 x 300 terracotta tiles to the building exterior.

I worked for AECOM/URS for the last 3 and a half months of my working holiday visa in Germany. There I was a part of a process to make a second verification of the quality and quantity of received stock, before issuing it off to the next handler.

company: Renovations by Vaughan - Adelaide, South Australia
description: I continued to work for Renovations by Vaughan for another 5 and a half years after my appenticeship. I assumed the role as leading hand, managing teams between 1 and 4 people depending on the type of project. I left my role in May 2016 to start the preparations of a working holiday visa in Germany.
other_tasks: Carrying out construction, alterations or renovations to residential and on occasion commercial structures;
Management and organisation of work sites;
Assisted in the training of apprentices, and

company: Renovations by Vaughan - Adelaide, South Australia
description: I officially started working for Renovations by Vaughan in January 2007 after completing a 2 week work experience in December 2006 and straight after year 12. After a couple of years into my apprenticeship I would occasionally take on the leading hand role and manage 1 - 2 other apprentices under the guidence of my supervisor.
other_tasks: Assisting the leading hand with the construction, alteration or renovation of residential structures;
Collection and assembly of building supplies;
Maintaining a clean and safe work environment;
Fulfilling and completing any training or module requirements, and
